summary: This document is an email chain from August 14, 2019, regarding 11 staff members at an unspecified facility who were on AWOL (Absent Without Leave) status for the week of August 4-10, 2019. The email lists the reasons for their absence, primarily related to OWCP (Office of Workers' Compensation Programs) cases ending, lack of LWOP (Leave Without Pay) approval, and medical issues. An augmentation agreement is mentioned as an attachment.

persons.name: Jim
persons.context: Addressed in the email thanking him for his help regarding the AWOL staff situation.

events.title: Staff AWOL Period
events.description: Eleven staff members were on AWOL (Absent Without Leave) status for a total of 40 hours during this week.

keyFacts: Eleven staff members were reported as AWOL for the week of August 4-10, 2019, totaling 40 hours of absence.
The primary reasons for absence were OWCP (workers' compensation) cases ending without the employees returning, lack of approved LWOP (Leave Without Pay), and medical issues/surgeries.
One staff member was a probationary officer injured in a motorcycle accident but had recent LWOP approval.
Another staff member had extended military orders that had expired without new LWOP approval.
An augmentation agreement was attached to the correspondence, but there was no agreement concerning overtime sign-up procedures.
